shortText: UT Yadav to Warner, no run
comm_cricinfo: some bounce. From back of a length as it slants away from Warner in the corridor. He pokes at it with no feet and it rises past his outside edge. Uthappa appeals, it wasn't even close
comm_cricbuzz: 0.1    U Yadav to Warner, no run, what? Is this Chinnaswamy? Sharp bounce. Keeps climbing as Davey Warner draws his bat away from harm's way at the last possible minute. Some swing away from the left-hander and he has been done for the extra zip and bounce. Good start. Stifled appeal, but the umpire stays unmoved

comm_cricinfo: back of a length, climbs at his hips. Gets on top of the bounce and drops it into the leg side to get off the mark
comm_cricbuzz: 0.2    U Yadav to Warner, 1 run, another back of a length delivery that keeps leaping up towards the ribcage, Warner drops it into the leg-side to nab a quick single

shortText: UT Yadav to Dhawan, no run
comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, bounce again. Shapes to punch into the off side, has to adjust and defend it to point
comm_cricbuzz: 0.3    U Yadav to Dhawan, no run, stays leg-side of a good length delivery and cuts to point

comm_cricinfo: metronomical stuff. Back of a length at off stump, defended with soft hands off the back foot to steal a single at point
comm_cricbuzz: 0.4    U Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, makes use of the width and plants the ball into the point region

shortText: UT Yadav to Warner, FOUR runs
comm_cricinfo: and that's why T20 is not a bowler's game. It's a great Test match line and length he has been bowling so far, climbing in the corridor to both left handers. But Warner knows it's coming now. Backs away and slices it over point
comm_cricbuzz: 0.5    U Yadav to Warner, FOUR, up on his toes and off she goes! Backs away and creates all the room he wanted, flays Umesh Yadav up and over cover, no-one in the deep. Take four!

comm_cricinfo: changes up, swings this into leg stump at a length, Warner gets on his toes and nudges this to mid-on's left
comm_cricbuzz: 0.6    U Yadav to Warner, 1 run, knocks the ball around the corner and keeps strike

comm_cricinfo: some swing away. Warner is three yards down the pitch before Boult delivers, and he adjusts by dropping it short of a length and swinging it away from his outside edge as he is forced to fend
comm_cricbuzz: 1.1    Boult to Warner, no run, angles it in from round the wicket and locks Warner in strife, plays all over it and gets beaten for swing. That was so close to groping the outer edge

comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off stump, swinging away. Warner closes the face on this and pushes it to mid-on on the up
comm_cricbuzz: 1.2    Boult to Warner, no run, hops back and pushes the ball towards mid-on

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, whipped off the hips to deep square
comm_cricbuzz: 1.3    Boult to Warner, 1 run, zips onto Warner who is on the back foot, he pulls square on the leg-side

comm_cricinfo: back of a length and swinging away from off stump, opens the face and runs it to third man
comm_cricbuzz: 1.4    Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, room on the other side for Dhawan, he steers it wide of third man

comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off, wants to pull this, but it swings away from him so he is forced to adjust. Slaps it on the up to mid-off
comm_cricbuzz: 1.5    Boult to Warner, no run, stands tall and smashes the ball flat to mid-off, lot of forearm power on that

comm_cricinfo: this time he goes for the pull anyway. back of a length, outside off, swing too. Smothers it, uses his wrists to hit it past the non-striker and bisects mid-on and mid-off
comm_cricbuzz: 1.6    Boult to Warner, FOUR, 140ks, short and wide. What does Warner do? No feet, just uses the leeway and forehand smacks it dead straight, over the umpire and into the fence

comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off stump, steps out and gets it off the sticker of the bat as he looks to drive, rolls feebly to mid-off
comm_cricbuzz: 2.1    U Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, jumps down the pitch, the extra zip and bounce means Dhawan mistimes the punch to mid-off. A single nonetheless

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, slight movement in. Warner gets the front leg out of the way and slashes, expecting this to go on with the angle. But he is cramped, squeezes it out to mid-off
comm_cricbuzz: 2.2    U Yadav to Warner, 1 run, good pace, Warner with a bit of side-on stance forces the punch wide of extra cover

shortText: UT Yadav to Dhawan, no run
comm_cricinfo: back of a length, angled away from the batsman, who shuffles before dabbing this. Straight to short third man.
comm_cricbuzz: 2.3    U Yadav to Dhawan, no run, glides the ball with an open bat face, straight to backward point. A bit of fumble there. Yes-no, yes-no. They decide against the single in the end

shortText: UT Yadav to Dhawan, no run
comm_cricinfo: bouncer on a leg stump line. Dhawan shuffles again, so he's inside the line as he looks to hook this. Too quick for him, he's well beaten
comm_cricbuzz: 2.4    U Yadav to Dhawan, no run, hurls it short and evades Dhawan who was late on the swivel pull, he suffled too far across and hence missed the line

shortText: UT Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR runs
comm_cricinfo: stays in position this time and nails the pull shot. This is short and straight, Dhawan stands tall and swivels slightly as he dispatches this to the long leg boundary
comm_cricbuzz: 2.5    U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, got complete hold of it this time. Umesh Yadav looks to bring the fine leg fielder into play. Tries the short ball again, but this one had no venom, right in the zone for Dhawan who hacks it away with blazing swing of the bat

comm_cricinfo: waits for the one that goes way, gets it at a short length, and chops it to deep point to retain the strike
comm_cricbuzz: 2.6    U Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, cut away late past the fielder at backward point

comm_cricinfo: good length outside off stump, it slides through and gets the underedge as he looks to play a late cut, gets it wide of slip for a single
comm_cricbuzz: 3.1    Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, gee! Uthappa is so chirpy behind the stumps. Shouting his lungs out. Back of a length, grips a touch, chopped to backward point

comm_cricinfo: good length, angled into the pads and thuds into the thigh, hard, as he looks to glance this
comm_cricbuzz: 3.2    Boult to Warner, leg byes, 1 run, slants in and cracks Warner on the thigh pad as he fails to make contact with the tuck

comm_cricinfo: good length at middle stump, slight angle in, and he uses it to punch on the up to mid-on
comm_cricbuzz: 3.3    Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, slides back and taps the ball straight of mid-on

comm_cricinfo: gives him the charge, gets a short one outside off stump. Wants to bludgeon this wide of mid-off on the up, but he finds the fielder
comm_cricbuzz: 3.4    Boult to Warner, no run, looks to get on top of a short and wide delivery, goes flat and hard, but hits it straight to mid-off instead

comm_cricinfo: offcutter, good length outside off stump, leans into this nicely and drives to extra cover's right
comm_cricbuzz: 3.5    Boult to Warner, 1 run, makes room and thwacks the drive to cover who is standing at the edge of the circle

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, bunts this off the outside half of the bat with the late cut. Coulter-Nile, the last line of defence square on the off side, dives to his right at short third man and keeps it to one
comm_cricbuzz: 3.6    Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, dabs away late to the right of short third where Coulter-Nile pulls off a commendable dive to prevent a boundary

shortText: UT Yadav to Dhawan, no run
comm_cricinfo: good length, angled wide of off stump, swings across the line and connects nicely. But he finds Coulter-Nile at mid-on
comm_cricbuzz: 4.1    U Yadav to Dhawan, no run, get a feeling that Dhawan and Warner are trying too hard. Not working out at the moment. Slogs a fullish delivery across the line, can't get it past mid-on

wkt_text: S Dhawan c †Uthappa b UT Yadav 11 (19m 13b 1x4 0x6) SR: 84.61
comm_cricinfo: high into the Bengaluru sky, and the local man pouches it...just about. This was good length, climbing up at a middle stump line. He gets the front leg out of the way and slashes across the line. Slices it high and Uthappa calls, gets under it and is then forced to stretch well in front of his body as it swerves. Holds on.
comm_cricbuzz: 4.2   U Yadav to Dhawan, out Caught by Uthappa!! There you go. I have called it. Umesh Yadav has good memories the last time he played here. Got a 3-fer I reckon. Hits the deck hard and gets good bounce which keeps rising en route to Dhawan, he looks to loft high over the infield, but he has mistimed it big time. Uthappa calls for it, steadies himself with a forward dive to complete the catch. Dhawan c Uthappa b U Yadav 11(13) [4s-1]

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, dabbed to short third man who gets a nice bounce and shies at the stumps, misses. Williamson was in though
comm_cricbuzz: 4.3    U Yadav to Warner, 1 run, cut away to backward point for a quick single, Suryakumar has a shy and misses at the batting end. Williamson was home anyway

shortText: UT Yadav to Williamson, no run
comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off stump, pushes it off the back foot into the off side
comm_cricbuzz: 4.4    U Yadav to Williamson, no run, such sweet sound! On his toes and punches a good length delivery to cover-point

shortText: UT Yadav to Williamson, no run
comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off stump, dabs and finds Yusuf Pathan at gully. The ball strikes him before he can get down and put out the barrier
comm_cricbuzz: 4.5    U Yadav to Williamson, no run, looks to deviate the ball past backward point, but hits it a little finer than he wanted. Straight to the fielder

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at middle stump, backs away, drops it very neatly into the off side and they steal a single
comm_cricbuzz: 4.6    U Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, doesn't hurry himself onto the ball, just taps it with soft hands and completes the single with ease. Test match stuff

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at middle stump, spins in sharply and gets him on the thigh guard as he looks to glance this
comm_cricbuzz: 5.1    Narine to Williamson, no run, spins in sharply and raps Williamson on the back pad, pretty high and leg-sidish. Williamson played well outside the line there

comm_cricinfo: good length at middle stump, gets him on the thigh again as he looks to play the glance
comm_cricbuzz: 5.2    Narine to Williamson, no run, from front of the hand, spin again. Williamson misses the clip and wears it high on the pad, again

comm_cricinfo: this one spins away. Short and slightly wide, punches away from the body, finds cover point
comm_cricbuzz: 5.3    Narine to Williamson, no run, flatter outside off, Williamson hits fiercely but can't hit the gap on the off-side

comm_cricinfo: good length at middle stump, tapped on the up to long-on
comm_cricbuzz: 5.4    Narine to Williamson, 1 run, sits deep inside the crease and manoeuvres the ball to long-on

comm_cricinfo: for a brief moment he tries to hustle the bowler, shapes to switch. Then holds his shape and plays the traditional off drive at this full ball, gets a single down to long-off
comm_cricbuzz: 5.5    Narine to Warner, 1 run, tossed up full on off-stump, Warner leans into the drive, wide of long-off

comm_cricinfo: this one straightens and gets the outside edge. Good length at middle stump, looks to hit on the up to long-on, gets a single to short third man
comm_cricbuzz: 5.6    Narine to Williamson, 1 run, edged and safe! Looks to force the punch, the ball grips a touch and takes the thick outside edge which dribbles to short third

comm_cricinfo: drops it short at middle stump from around the wicket, pulls it off the middle, straight to deep square
comm_cricbuzz: 6.1    Y Pathan to Williamson, 1 run, poor delivery, but Yusuf Pathan gets away with it. Dragged half-way down the pitch, Williamson pulls, but lack of timing meant it had gone straight to the fielder at deep mid-wicket

comm_cricinfo: tossed it up wide off stump, Warner takes it on, hits it aerially towards extra cover. It drops short of the fielder
comm_cricbuzz: 6.2    Y Pathan to Warner, no run, lovely floater outside off, Warner clobbers the drive, straight to extar cover

comm_cricinfo: full at leg stump, driven to long-on off the front foot
comm_cricbuzz: 6.3    Y Pathan to Warner, 1 run, too full on the stumps, a drilled on-drive to long-on

comm_cricinfo: oh what a lovely shot. This is full at leg stump, and it's fired flat from around the wicket. He exposes all stumps, gets to the pitch and lifts it inside-out over extra cover
comm_cricbuzz: 6.4    Y Pathan to Williamson, FOUR, class written all over it. Gives himself room outside leg and lofts Yusuf Pathan inside out over extra cover. Can't set field for that kind of a shot when you are gonna pitch around middle and leg, sheer brilliance from KW!

comm_cricinfo: good length, angled across off stump. He fends off the front foot, away from the body. Gets an inside edge onto pad
comm_cricbuzz: 6.5   Y Pathan to Williamson, no run, shout for lbw, but KW has got a massive inside edge on that one. Quicker delivery, keeps sliding onto the stumps, Williamson tucks himself into a defence, does well to prevent the ball from rolling onto the stumps

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at middle stump, steps down the track and punches uppishly to long-on
comm_cricbuzz: 6.6    Y Pathan to Williamson, 1 run, chips the drive to the left of mid-off, easy single

comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off stump. Gets off his feet and shovels this into the leg side with some wristwork
comm_cricbuzz: 7.1    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, 1 run, shuffles like Steve Smith and uses VVS-esque wrists to milk a single through mid-wicket

comm_cricinfo: short and skidding into the pads. He gets the front leg up as he whips this straight to short fine. Williamson calls early and beats the fielder
comm_cricbuzz: 7.2    Coulter-Nile to Warner, 1 run, on the pads, tickled away towards short fine

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at middle stump, he backs away and looks to poke this to third man, beaten on the outside edge
comm_cricbuzz: 7.3    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, no run, lands on a good length and beats Williamson who was backing away too far outside his stumps. Was trying for a late-cut, but was done by a bit of extra bounce

comm_cricinfo: good bowling. A bouncer, well directed right above his right shoulder. He shuffles across and gets inside the line, then misses the hook shot
comm_cricbuzz: 7.4    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, no run, bouncer, sails over a swivelling KW. Beaten for pace this time. Runs hard to come by...

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, shuffles across and turns the face too early to try and get a single through the leg side. Gets a leading edge to extra cover...who made Warner panic at the non-striker's with a quick release. No direct hit and he would've been in
comm_cricbuzz: 7.5    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, no run, looks to tuck, closes the bat face a little too early and pops a leading edge towards cover. Warner had to rush to ground his bat as Piyush Chawla fired a throw at his end

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, cramps him, forces him to defend back down the pitch
comm_cricbuzz: 7.6    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, no run, attacking the stumps, good length, played back to the bowler

comm_cricinfo: back of a length slider, middle stump. Makes room and punches it straight to extra cover
comm_cricbuzz: 8.1    Chawla to Warner, no run, KKR bowlers continue to join dots. Warner camps back and punches the ball hard, straight to cover

comm_cricinfo: dropped short at middle stump, he hangs deep in the crease and punishes the ball, the bowler, and a plastic seat behind the deep midwicket boundary, with a pull
comm_cricbuzz: 8.2    Chawla to Warner, SIX, Warner has mixed all his frustration and power on that shot. Attempted googly, lands too short for Warner's liking, he rocks back and fires it into the stands over mid-wicket

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at middle stump, punches it wide of long-on off the back foot
comm_cricbuzz: 8.3    Chawla to Warner, 1 run, long-hop again, on the back foot is Warner, pulling along the ground wide of long-on

comm_cricinfo: googly, full at middle stump. Leans into it and tries to tickle into the leg side, gets it on the front pad
comm_cricbuzz: 8.4    Chawla to Williamson, no run, slider, Williamson plays down the wrong line, it goes past the inside edge before knocking him on the pad

comm_cricinfo: good length outside off stump, waits for it to turn, drops it to short third man's right. He gets low quickly and hits the stumps, but Warner was really quick and got out a great stretch with a grounded bat
comm_cricbuzz: 8.5   Chawla to Williamson, 1 run, dabbed away late by Kane Williamson. Warner wanted the single, he beats a direct hit by Sunil Narine from backward point. Well and truly inside the crease

comm_cricinfo: slider at middle stump, good length. Gets well back in the crease and whips it to deep midwicket
comm_cricbuzz: 8.6    Chawla to Warner, 1 run, wrong 'un on middle, tucked all along the carpet to cow corner

comm_cricinfo: good length at off stump, steps out, makes room, squeezes it out to long-off
comm_cricbuzz: 9.1    Coulter-Nile to Warner, 1 run, steps out of his crease and takes Coulter-Nile on the full to drive him down to long-off

comm_cricinfo: gorgeous. Good length ball outside off stump, he shuffles well across to get behind it. It doesn't quite come on but he uses his wrists and lifts this on the up over the midwicket fielder
comm_cricbuzz: 9.2    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, FOUR, why worry when you can play shots like these? Walks well across his stumps and meets the ball with greatest of ease, chips the punchy on-drive over mid-wicket

comm_cricinfo: short ball at off stump, shuffles across, uses the angle and some of his power, lifts this wide of the deep square leg fielder
comm_cricbuzz: 9.3    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, SIX, sure that time-out has helped KW. Settling into his groove now. Gets into position early and dispatches a short ball flat into the backward square stands

comm_cricinfo: shuffles across again, looks to bunt this length ball to third man, gets an inside edge that teases the keeper who can't save the single
comm_cricbuzz: 9.4    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, 1 run, chops a length delivery wide of the keeper and scurries through for a quick single

comm_cricinfo: full toss, tailing in at leg stump, pushed weakly to midwicket
comm_cricbuzz: 9.5    Coulter-Nile to Warner, no run, full toss, angling in, Warner hits it straight to Lynny at mid-wicket

comm_cricinfo: miscues a pull shot. This is back of a length, skidding in fast at his chest and hurrying him on the pull. He drags it uppishly to long-on
comm_cricbuzz: 9.6    Coulter-Nile to Warner, 1 run, this one doesn't come at a pace Warner was anticipating, he mistimes the pull over mid-wicket

comm_cricinfo: dropped short at middle stump, goes against the turn and places the pull shot between deep square and deep midwicket
comm_cricbuzz: 10.1    Narine to Warner, 2 runs, off-break from a shortish length, Warner pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a couple. Good running between the wickets

comm_cricinfo: oh nice. Good length, pitches on middle stump, turns and bounces away sharply past the outside edge as he pokes off the front foot
comm_cricbuzz: 10.2    Narine to Warner, no run, ah! Beaten. The off-cutter in that nagging length outside off, Warner sticks his bat out and fails to connect

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at leg stump, whips it to deep square
comm_cricbuzz: 10.3    Narine to Warner, 1 run, moves across in his crease does Warner, to whip away this length ball behind square on the on-side

comm_cricinfo: good length at off stump, gets behind the line, drops it into the off side off the front foot
comm_cricbuzz: 10.4    Narine to Williamson, 1 run, on the stumps, Williamson drops it towards covers with soft hands for a quick single

comm_cricinfo: ah there it is. The switch hit. Well, a flick, anyway. Morphs into a right hander, flicks it straight to midwicket off the middle stump
comm_cricbuzz: 10.5    Narine to Warner, no run, ah! The switch hit from Warner. Wrists a fullish ball to short cover

comm_cricinfo: butchered. Drops it marginally short at middle stump and Warner is quickly back. Slams this hard on the up, sends it way over long-on
comm_cricbuzz: 10.6    Narine to Warner, SIX, that's a massive shot! No doubt, it's Warner. Slightly short, Warner sees it and is quick to jump back in his crease. Pummels the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands

comm_cricinfo: full outside off stump, shuffles across, gets to the pitch and flick-drives it to long-on
comm_cricbuzz: 11.1    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, 1 run, pitched up delivery, wristy drive to long-on

comm_cricinfo: nice. Warner backs away, does so too much. Coulter-Nile bowls a yorker outside off, he can't do anything but leave it
comm_cricbuzz: 11.2    Coulter-Nile to Warner, no run, ah! Warner backs away a long way and Coulter-Nile darts it full outside off, the batter can't reach that. A dot

comm_cricinfo: good length, angling into Warner, who looks to get on one knee and ramp this wide of short fine. Takes it on the back thigh, and it runs down to third man
comm_cricbuzz: 11.3    Coulter-Nile to Warner, leg byes, 1 run, good ball. Sees the batsman move leg-side and darts it on the body cramping up Warner for room. Warner fails to put bat on ball and the ball rolls behind square on the off-side off his body

comm_cricinfo: ouch. Misses the short slower ball at off stump as he shuffles across to pull. Gets this flush on his right elbow and incredibly, doesn't seem to be in too much pain as this deflects to third man
comm_cricbuzz: 11.4   Coulter-Nile to Williamson, leg byes, 1 run, good change of pace. Slower short ball, Williamson didn't pick that at all. He is early into his stroke. The ball strikes his arm and runs wide of the keeper. Another leg-bye

comm_cricinfo: full toss at middle stump, cramped for room, pushed straight to extra cover
comm_cricbuzz: 11.5    Coulter-Nile to Warner, 1 run, once again, no room on offer for Warner. It was a low full toss to Warner who was backing away. Mistimed drill to cover. Brings up the 50-run stand

wkt_text: KS Williamson c SA Yadav b Coulter-Nile 24 (35m 26b 2x4 1x6) SR: 92.30
comm_cricinfo: straight to extra cover. Good length outside off stump, looks to lift this over extra cover, but there's no pace on the shot because there was no pace off the pitch. He finds the fielder
comm_cricbuzz: 11.6    Coulter-Nile to Williamson, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! The ploy to bring in NCN has worked. He has been superb at the death, but GG needed a wicket here. Fullish length delivery outside off, Williamson doesn't get underneath it and goes hard on his lofted extra drive. Finds extra cover to perfection. Williamson c Suryakumar Yadav b Coulter-Nile 24(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

comm_cricinfo: full at leg stump, drilled back down the pitch, straight to the bowler
comm_cricbuzz: 12.1    Chawla to Warner, no run, very full, Warner wrists it back to the bowler

comm_cricinfo: he's got him! Two wickets in three balls for Kolkata! Pushes this back of a length, flat, and gets it to turn slightly. Warner wants to pull this but it isn't short enough. He's on the back foot and is forced to bring down an angled bat instead of a flat bat. Too much to do. It skids through and takes middle stump.
comm_cricbuzz: 12.2    Chawla to Warner, out Bowled!! Two big wickets within a span of three balls. This will hurt the defending champions. Piyush Chawla gets the big fish. Warner probably misjudged the length. Did that keep low? Not sure. It was a slider from a good length, Warner went back to pull it away. Misses it by a long way and the ball crashes the middle stump. Gauti is animated in his celebration. Warner b Chawla 37(35) [4s-2 6s-2]

comm_cricinfo: dropped short outside off stump, punches against the turn off the back foot, down to long-on
comm_cricbuzz: 12.3    Chawla to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, eases a single down to long-on

shortText: Chawla to Yuvraj Singh, no run
comm_cricinfo: nearly lobs on to midwicket. This stops at Yuvraj. It's good length at middle stump, he's expecting it to turn but it rises as he closes the face on the flick. It lands in front of midwicket
comm_cricbuzz: 12.4    Chawla to Yuvraj, no run, slower through the air, the top-spinner, Yuvraj is tentative in his block. The ball dies down on the leg-side off the inside part of the bat

shortText: Chawla to Yuvraj Singh, FOUR runs
comm_cricinfo: class. Pure class. This is overpitched outside off stump. He leans into it and places it perfectly to the right of long-off. He could've stopped that, he dived over it, but that was travelling quickly
comm_cricbuzz: 12.5    Chawla to Yuvraj, FOUR, why do you bowl that? Easy runs on offer for Yuvraj and he gets off the mark with a delightful stroke. Quicker and overpitched outside off, Yuvi plants his front leg forward and middles the drive. No chance for long-off

shortText: Chawla to Yuvraj Singh, no run
comm_cricinfo: sir Chawla. Googly, good length, off stump. He goes forward to defend, beaten comprehensively on the outside edge
comm_cricbuzz: 12.6    Chawla to Yuvraj, no run, ah! Beauty to end the over. Chawla slows his pace and delivers a wrong 'un. Yuvraj gets beaten on the outside edge

comm_cricinfo: good length at off stump, solidly behind this to defend off the front foot
comm_cricbuzz: 13.1    Narine to Vijay Shankar, no run, off-break on off, a forward block

comm_cricinfo: great fielding. He gets this late cut wide of first slip, but Gambhir gets down to his right and holds on to it quickly with a dive. That didn't turn, went straight on from a length outside off stump
comm_cricbuzz: 13.2    Narine to Vijay Shankar, no run, plays late and cuts it cheekily. But GG is there at first slip to dive to his right and stop that

comm_cricinfo: doesn't get all of this slog, but he gets it in the gap. Full at middle stump, he isn't to the pitch, but he lifts it over midwicket. A couple of bounces and into the boundary
comm_cricbuzz: 13.3    Narine to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, bit like Guptill. Slogs across the line and the head is tilted downards. Slowish offie on middle and leg, Shankar swings across the line and gets good wood behind it. One bounce and into the fence. The man in the deep probably didn't pick it up

comm_cricinfo: good length at leg stump, pushed on the up to long-on
comm_cricbuzz: 13.4    Narine to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, wrists the drive down to long-on

shortText: Narine to Yuvraj Singh, no run
comm_cricinfo: the perfect offspinner. Good length at off stump, he fends off the front foot nervously and it rips past the outside edge

shortText: Narine to Yuvraj Singh, no run
comm_cricinfo: good length at middle stump, turns it away, he looks to flick across the line, can't get it past pitchside
comm_cricbuzz: 13.6    Narine to Yuvraj, no run, similar delivery, a tentative poke from the southpaw. Just 5 runs from the over

comm_cricinfo: good length at off stump, goes back and across, jams it out to sweeper cover

shortText: Chawla to Yuvraj Singh, FOUR runs
comm_cricinfo: Vijay Shankar doesn't have a helmet because it's spin from both ends. But he doesn't account for the fact that it's also Yuvraj from one end. Has to get down quickly as Yuvraj drills this full ball past his face from an off stump line

comm_cricinfo: good length at middle stump, not to the pitch, heaves across the line, gets it off the inside half to deep midwicket

comm_cricinfo: finds Chawla at deep backward square. This a bouncer and it doesn't come on. Yuvraj is marginally early on the hook and he skews it off the top edge to Chawla, who takes it awkwardly to his left. It was swerving away from him and he didn't get behind it. But he held on.

wkt_text: CJ Jordan c & b Coulter-Nile 0 (1m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
comm_cricinfo: superb diving catch by Coulter-Nile! Digs it in, back of a length at off stump. Gets it to sit in the pitch and induces the leading edge as Jordan tries to flick this into the leg side. Then recovers, stretches one-handed to his left, follows the trajectory closely and tumbles at just the right time to hold on to it
comm_cricbuzz: 18.3   Coulter-Nile to Jordan, out Caught&Bowled!! Another one bites the dust. Three wickets in four balls for Coulter-Nile. The ball stuck a bit on the surface. It was a shortish delivery, Jordan is a bit early to close his bat face. The leading edge flies to the left of the bowler, who times his dive to his left to perfection. A terrific catch in his followthrough. Jordan c and b Coulter-Nile 0(1)

comm_cricinfo: full delivery, with hints of away swing, Uthappa taps and runs to mid-off

comm_cricbuzz: 0.2    Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, SIX, backs away and cracks the cut, the ball sails over the man at point as he opened the face of the blade on that. That hit the cushion on the full.

wkt_text: CA Lynn c †Ojha b Kumar 6 (4m 2b 0x4 1x6) SR: 300.00
comm_cricinfo: huge appeal for a caught behind, but umpire Menon shakes his head for a moment before going to check with his partner. They call the third umpire in and the soft signal is out. Right then, this is a near yorker, which Lynn tries to squeeze out. But the ball pitches just before his bat and takes a bit of an edge through to Ojha. And it's a red light. Lynn's gone. Bhuvi gets right of the danger man like a boss!
comm_cricbuzz: 0.3    Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Full and swinging away, the batsman backed away to jam it. He thudded the bat onto the ground but the ball chalked the bottom part of the willow on the way. The on-field umpire went upstairs who had a look and gave it in favour of the bowler. Bhuvi does it again for SRH. Chris Lynn c Naman Ojha b Bhuvneshwar 6(2) [6s-1]

comm_cricinfo: Yusuf Pathan has earned a promotion and is he run-out first ball? Yes! It's Bhuvi again! What a player! He's bowling according to the batsman. Lynn liked length balls, so he does him in with a yorker. Pathan loves the full ones, so he bowls back of a length and cramps him up by getting the ball to angle into middle and leg. Pathan swings wildly, gets winded as the ball hits his gut, then scampers out of his crease blindly. Bhuvi, alert as ever, races up, gets the ball and underarms it on target
comm_cricbuzz: 0.4    Bhuvneshwar to Y Pathan, out Y Pathan Run Out!! The ball jagged back in and Pathan missed the heave. The ball thudded the back pad and went away towards the bowler. Yusuf unaware of it, looked for a suicidal single. But Bhuvi in his his followthrough gathered it and flicked it onto the sticks to catch him short. This is tragedy for KKR. He was in no position to take a single. Y Pathan run out (Bhuvneshwar) 0(1)

comm_cricinfo: back of a length on off stump, the ball cutting back in a touch, Gambhir chops it behind the wicket to the keeper
comm_cricbuzz: 0.5    Bhuvneshwar to Gambhir, no run, taps the ball down and the ball rolls back to the keeper. He wanted a single but was sent back

comm_cricinfo: a little room again and Gambhir slashes it over point. KKR may have lost two wickets, but they have more than the eight runs an over they need. That's the advantage they have having bowled Sunrisers out cheaply
comm_cricbuzz: 0.6    Bhuvneshwar to Gambhir, FOUR, cuts, goes aerial and gets it over the infield for a four. That was a poor ball, gave room and Gambhir feasted on that. That would relieve the KKR team management off some pressure

comm_cricinfo: starts with a good length ball that swings further away outside off. It's too far outside off. It's a wide.

wkt_text: RV Uthappa c Dhawan b Jordan 1 (10m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
comm_cricinfo: he's picked out the only man out there at deep midwicket! He does love those front foot pulls, and he gets the perfect ball for it. Loads up, doesn't bother keeping the ball down, and pays a huge price for his mistake. Three wickets in seven balls for Sunrisers! KKR under pressure. So much pressure.
comm_cricbuzz: 1.1    Jordan to Uthappa, out Caught by Dhawan!! Uthappa bites the dust now. That was a short ball and Uthappa went for the pull. He could not have placed it better for SRH fans to be sent into delirious mode. That held onto the batsman a bit more and so did the bounce, tad bit extra to plot his downfall. KKR into panicky mode now. Uthappa c Dhawan b Jordan 1(2)

comm_cricinfo: KKR are through! The defending champions are knocked out! And the match ends finally at 1.27 am. The final act, a miscued pull to midwicket and a harried single. Gambhir punches the air and bellows out a war cry.
comm_cricbuzz: 5.2    Bipul Sharma to Jaggi, 1 run, KKR win!! That was shortish, the ball never arrived, the toe-end of the bat makes contact on the attempted pull and goes away bobbling onto the on-side. The man at mid-wicket picks, has a shy, misses and Gambhir punches his fist in the air. Whatta cameo from the skippy, no one saw it coming. But GG loves answering his critics back
